description:
A good week with a really tough finish. The goal is to squeeze in a 34 km round for the weekend.

- Good for many mentally to take with you, but if you have done a good long session before, you absolutely do not stand and fall with Sunday's session, but if you are tired, it is completely ok to shorten. You can also skip Saturday's session if you want and feel it is necessary to work towards + 30k the next day.

Other than that, we work with a little speed this week through Thursday's short hill and a marathon session as an introduction which you can shorten to 5-8 km if 10 km feels long just for the day.

The marathon run one last time in our long version. Sufficiently tough, and if you are tired, remove or lighten up to a calm 10-12 km round. Prioritize that you get into the hill with a little springy step on Thursday and then that you are charged for the program's longest long run next Sunday.

Warm up as usual with jogging, mobility and the running training exercises.

The hill should be a "slightly steeper version" but you should be able to run with good strides and be able to last around 20-25 seconds in the uphill and feel a little lactic acid in your legs on top". Take a few (5-10) seconds of rest both at the turning point of your short hill and before starting the next hill. Focus on a good step with good drive. Work well with slightly faster arm movements and good knee assignments if it comes reasonably naturally to you. No completely unfamiliar movements now...

Important to unwind with a calm jog and stretch!

Easy extra run that really is extra. Of course gives good effect with tomorrow's run; but run no injury or overtraining limits now to get this run. Only for those of you who feel like you're soaking up all the training right now! Prioritize tomorrow...

The program's longest long session!

Really long, and inevitably over 3 hours. YOUR CALM SPEED, and it's ok to slow down a notch more than you usually do to complete the distance!

Make sure you load up with some extra carbohydrates the day before, and bring drinks with you on the run. (feel free to try the sports drink if you haven't done it before) Test your intended competition shoes, and see that they work with your feet all the way.

It is extremely important that you are careful after the session, with energy, drink and dry clothes so that you do not the situation we're in now will catch you with an unnecessary cold.

-Make sure you get an hour's rest after the session, and don't have to do so much before the body has had time to recover a little at least!
